document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Ambrysus pulchellus Montandon species complex (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Naucoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Ambrysus pulchellus Montandon species complex (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Naucoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
A. vanduzeei Usinger 1946
: Univ. Kans. Sci. Bull., 31: 207–209 (original description).

A. vanduzeei : De Carlo 1950
, An. Soc. Cient. Argent., 150: 13 (list of taxa, distribution).

A. vanduzeei : La Rivers 1953a
, Univ. Kans. Sci. Bull., 35: 1284, 1308–1309 , 1342–1343 (key, supplemental description, habitus photo).

A. vanduzeei : La Rivers 1958
, Proc. Ent. Soc. Wash., 60: 72 (morphology).

A. vanduzeei : La Rivers 1965
, Biol. Soc. Nev. Occas. Pap., 4: 7 (subgeneric assignment, distribution).

A. vanduzeei : La Rivers 1971
, Biol. Soc. Nev. Mem., 2: 69 (list of taxa).

Diagnosis. ThIs spEcIEs cAN bE dIsTINGuIshEd fROm ThE OThERs IN ThIs cOmpLEx by ThE fEmALEs wITh ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of ThE SGP TApEREd TO A NARROwLy ROuNdEd ApEx ( FIG. 6F ). ThE LATERAL mARGINs ARE REfLExEd dORsAd, GIvING ThE SGP A sEmITubuLAR shApE. ALsO, ThE pOsTERIOR mARGIN Of LATEROsTERNITE VI Is ALmOsT sTRAIGhT ( FIG. 6F ). IN mALEs, ThE AGP Is cApITATE ANd wIdEsT AT ThE dIsTAL mARGIN ( FIG. 6B ). ThE psEudOpARAmEREs ARE sTRAIGhT mEsALLy (NO mEdIAL cONvExITy), wITh ThE pOsTEROmEsAL cORNER As AN INcONspIcuOus NARROwLy ROuNdEd LObE ( FIG. 6C ). ThE scuTELLum hAs A RENIfORm TO OvATE dARK bROwN mARK ON EAch sIdE Of ThE mIdLINE ( FIG. 6A ).

Discussion. ThIs spEcIEs wAs dEscRIbEd fROm A sERIEs Of spEcImENs cOLLEcTEd IN MuLEGé IN
BAjA CALIfORNIA SuR
, mOsT LIKELy IN ThE SANTA ROsALíA RIvER. BAsEd ON ThE uNIquE mORphOLOGy Of ThE fEmALE SGP , IT wAs cLEAR TO UsINGER ThAT ThIs wAs A dIsTINcT spEcIEs. IN ThIs wORK, UsINGER (1946) sTudIEd A TOTAL Of 20 spEcIEs, Of whIch 16 wERE dEscRIbEd As NEw spEcIEs. NOTwIThsTANdING ThE EvIdENcE, hE OvERLOOKEd ThE ImpORTANcE Of ThE SGP As A dIAGNOsTIc fEATuRE ANd dId NOT usE IT IN ThE dEscRIpTION Of ThE REmAINING spEcIEs. FOR LA RIvERs (1953A), ThIs uNIquELy shApEd SGP wAs sImILAR TO ThAT Of ThE SOuTh AmERIcAN ( BOLIvIA ) spEcIEs
A. ochraceus
MONTANdON. HE spEcuLATEd ThAT ThIs TypE Of SGP cOuLd bE usEd TO INsERT EGGs INTO pLANT TIssuE OR dEpOsIT ThEm IN cREvIcEs, whIch wOuLd pREsumAbLy mAKE ThE EGGs LEss AccEssIbLE TO ExpLOITERs.

Variation. ThE LEfT dORsAL fLAp Of ThE mALE phALLOsOmA, whIch Is A dIAGNOsTIc chARAcTER Of ThE spEcIEs cOmpLEx, Is GENERALLy LEss dEvELOpEd ANd IN sOmE spEcImENs cAN bE INcONspIcuOus ( FIG. 6E ). ALsO, ThE dIsTAL pART Of ThE psEudOpARAmEREs cAN bE TApEREd TO A cONspIcuOus ROuNdEd ApIcAL LObE

Type locality.
MéxIcO
:
BAjA CALIfORNIA SuR
, MpIO. MuLEGé, MuLEGé.
Repository. HOLOTypE Is hOusEd AT ThE CAS.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6. Structures of
Ambrysus vanduzeei
. (A) dorsal habitus of male, (B) 6th and 7th abdominal terga of male, (C) 8th abdominal tergum of male, (D) ventral surface of phallosoma, (E) left side of phallososma, (F) sternum VI and subgenital plate of female (terminal abdominal segments removed). ldf = left dorsal flap. Size bar = 0.5 mm and applies only to figures D and E.

Ambrysus vanduzeei Is
dIsTRIbuTEd ExcLusIvELy IN ThE
BAjA CALIfORNIA
PENINsuLA (
MExIcO
), IN ThE
BAjA CALIfORNIA
ANd CALIfORNIA bIOGEOGRAphIc pROvINcEs ( FIG. 2 ). ThE pREvIOus dIsTRIbuTION REcORds fOR ThE spEcIEs cAmE fROm
BAjA CALIfORNIA SuR
; hEREIN, wE REpORT ThE fIRsT REcORds fROm ThE sTATE Of
BAjA CALIfORNIA
. ThE ONLy OThER

TwO spEcIEs Of
Ambrysus
pREsENT IN ThAT AREA ARE
A. hungerfordi triunfo
LA RIvERs ANd
A. occidentalis
LA RIvERs.
Ambrysus vanduzeei
wAs fOuNd syNTOpIcALLy wITh
A. hungerfordi triunfo
AT ARROyO AGuA CALIENTE ( 12-VII-2004 ), ARROyO LAs PARRAs ( 10-VII-2004 ), ANd ARROyO SAN JORGE ( 17-VII-2004 ) IN BAjA CALIfORNIA SuR.
